Examples of volume rates assigned to each nozzle

title: Disease assessment
text:
207 experimental units means a lot of disease observation to do ! what is the best compromise between time spent and precision of observations ?


In spring, at phenological stage BBCH 53, a mapping of “flag shoots” symptoms of powdery mildew was realized.
At BBCH 77, we did 2 manual assessement of powdery mildew , one following EPPO standard and the other one in a “FAST” mode:







EPPO Standard
FAST assessment




% of bunch with powdery mildew
Class [0-5] of powdery mildew on bunches







81 observed units (40%)
50 bunches/unit : 4050 obs
9 persons
27 working hours
20 min/unit


207 observed units (on both sides)
10 vinestocks/unit : 4140 observation
6 persons
18 working hours
5.2 min/unit (4 times faster)







We also tested the recognition by artificial intelligence of downy mildew symptoms on images taken mid-july by drone in partnership with the company Chouette.



Downy mildiew assessment using AI

title: Flowrate variation range
text:
Flowrates vary by a factor from 1 to 4 depending on the DutyCycle selected.



Flowrate versus duty cycle

title: Introduction
text:
Welcome to the Precision spraying and Biospraytech demo !
UMT ECOTECH aims at developping precision spraying for optimising application of products : quantity, way to target the crop, coverage and water volumes. Biospraytech is our program to use precision spraying for assessing the most appropriate methods and sprayers settings to spray biocontrol and obtain protection programs that meet the Green Deal objectives.
The PWM prototype sprayer (Berthoud Win-Air fitted with Optima Concept® PWM nozzle control) to support this program can control each individual nozzle with a centrimetric precision on the vertical boom according to requirements provided in a map.
Vegetation maps such as made from mobile 2D Lidar measurements can also be used in the process.




Berthoud Win-Air fitted with Optima Concept® PWM nozzle control

title: Vegetation characterization
text:
To understand the effectiveness of phytosanitary protection, it is also necessary to characterize the vegetation. The structure of the vegetation was measured using a Lidar.



Lidar acquisition on grapevine


From the data we can calculate the vegetation height and width and calculate the Tree Row Volume Figure 1.





Figure 1: Map of TRV from LiDAR, 24 may 2023



Besides serving as interpretation tool with geometric characterization of vigour such as Tree Row Volume (TRV) and Leaf Wall Area (LWA), LiDAR information can be used to predict expected statistical and physical distribution of deposits on the vegetation by a known sprayer. This is documented in the following references :

Cheraiet et al. (2022)
Cheraiet et al. (2021)
Cheraïet et al. (2020)






References

Cheraiet, Anice, Olivier Naud, Mathilde Carra, Sébastien Codis, Frédéric Lebeau, and James Taylor. 2021. “Predicting the Site-Specific Distribution of Agrochemical Spray Deposition in Vineyards at Multiple Phenological Stages Using 2D LiDAR-Based Primary Canopy Attributes.” Computers and Electronics in Agriculture 189: 106402. https://doi.org/https://doi.org/10.1016/j.compag.2021.106402.


Cheraiet, Anice, James Taylor, Sébastien Codis, Pierre Petitot, Florent Bidaut, Matthieu Liebart, and Olivier Naud. 2022. “Testing the Suitability of a Terrestrial 2D LiDAR Scanner for 3D Canopy Characterisation of Narrow Vineyards to Optimise the Spraying Process.” In XXXI International Horticultural Congress (IHC2022): III International Symposium on Mechanization, Precision Horticulture, and 1360, 29–36. https://doi.org/https://doi.org/10.17660/ActaHortic.2023.1360.4.


Cheraïet, Anice, Olivier Naud, Mathilde Carra, Sébastien Codis, Frédéric Lebeau, and James Taylor. 2020. “An Algorithm to Automate the Filtering and Classifying of 2D LiDAR Data for Site-Specific Estimations of Canopy Height and Width in Vineyards.” Biosystems Engineering 200: 450–65. https://doi.org/https://doi.org/10.1016/j.biosystemseng.2020.10.016.

title: Experimental design
text: In 2023, we made a field trial on a 2h commercial vineyard to explore how the spray pattern and the dosage of PPP affects the control of Powdery Mildew.

title: Experimental design
text:
Experimental factors
In this experiment, 2 factors were tested :

the dose of phytosanitary products : from 0.7 to 2x the reference dose (1N)
the spray pattern :




Spray pattern modalities


10 experimental treatments with around 20 replicates each Table 1 : 207 experimental units were implemented on the field thanks to the prototype PWM sprayer.
